## unwrap() function

Unwraps a value and ensures it is not null or undefined.

Inspired by rust's `unwrap` function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function unwrap<T>(maybe: T, error?: string | Error): UnwrapResult<T, Error>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

maybe


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The value to unwrap


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

error


</td><td>

string \| Error


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The error to throw if input is null or undefined


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[UnwrapResult](./toolkit.unwrapresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, Error&gt;

The input value if it exists, otherwise throws an error

## Exceptions

- When the input value is null or undefined

## Example 1


```ts
function fetchUser(): Promise<User | null> { ... }

const user = await fetchUser(); // Promise<User | null>
const safeUser = unwrap(user); // User
const name = unwrap(safeUser.name); // string
```

## Example 2


```ts
const details = unwrap(
  document.querySelector("details"),
); // HTMLDetailsElement
```
